Welcome To Mobile Refresh - Wellington, July 1st 2016
One-day conference for 150 mobile technology enthusiasts
Agenda


Registration is now closed

Location

Victoria University, Kelburn Parade, Kelburn, Wellington

Date

Friday, July 1, 2016, 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM

GDG Wellington, together with Cocoaheads Wellington is proud to bring you Mobile Refresh - Wellington July 1st, 2016. Our one-day conference is aimed at 150 mobile technology enthusiasts who are interested in a quick update on the latest developments announced at Google I/O and WWDC.

Mobile Refresh will provide content for designers, developers, testers, or just about anyone passionate about mobile development. The vast majority of the sessions will be interactive, but there is no expectation that everyone must contribute.

The conference takes a split approach: the morning is reserved for panel discussions and Q&A, while the afternoon is going to follow an un-conference format where the audience has a big say in the selection of discussion topics.

We are privileged to have a number of speakers (and a diverse set of talks) lined up for the afternoon. Please check back closer to the date for an updated agenda.

Attendees should expect discussions that cover both iOS and Android. The two platforms solve similar problems (albeit with different approaches), and it is our hope that at the end of the day everyone will have learned new things.

We look forward to spending a day of learning and sharing with all of you. Until then, you can reach us via Twitter or Slack.

Agenda

We will keep updating the agenda until the event.

The times of the sessions may change on the day of the event to accommodate our speakers.
 
8:00am Registration. Come early to pick up your swag.
8:30am Welcome
8:45am I/O and WWDC Panel discussion and Q&A (with breaks)
12:00pm Lunch
1:00pm Sessions. Our speakers come from: Google, PaperKite, Powershop, Trade Me, and more.
We'll update this agenda with more details soon.
4:30pm Wrap-up
 
Apart from lunch, we will also provide morning and afternoon tea.

Speakers

We will keep updating the list of speakers until the event.

We are truly privledged to present you with a fantastic selection of speakers.
 
Ian Lewis (Google Japan) Google Cloud Platform - Firebase Storage
Melby Ruarus (Google Australia) The Places API: Helping the Modern Bushwalker in the Urban Jungle
Kai Koenig (Ventego Creative) Little helpers for Android development with Kotlin
Lucas Soares (Android Developer - Trade Me) Using Firebase to acquire and engage the right users at the right time
Steven Tan (Android Developer - Powershop) Android Wear
Julius Spencer (JSA) Smartphone Test Farm
Farlei Heinen (Mobile Developer - PaperKite) Google Cardboard
Leandro Persalta (Android Developer - Powershop) Migrating to MVP
Josh Burton (Android Guild Lead - Trade Me)
Rick Chen (Chapter Lead - Trade Me)		 Being Smart About Login
 
Ruth Brown (Head of UX - Trade Me) Panel
Jason Willows (Product Owner of Mobile - Powershop) Panel
Andrew Millar (Creative Director - PaperKite) Panel
 
Kate Henderson (Mobile Developer - PaperKite) Moderator
Nick Parfene (Head of Mobile - Trade Me) Moderator

About US

Google Developer Group (GDG) Wellington is a friendly, inclusive, supportive, accessible, and community focused group of people that meet regularly to discuss the latest developments in Googleâ€™s ecosystem.

Cocoaheads Wellington is a group devoted to discussion of Apple's Cocoa and CocoaTouch Frameworks for programming on iOS, watchOS, tvOS, and macOS.

Disclaimer: GDG Wellington is an independent group; our activities and the opinions expressed here should in no way be linked to Google, the corporation.

Code of Conduct

We expect all people attending at our event to have read and accepted our Code of Conduct.
